main event: An air traffic controller at Modoc Point, Oregon observed a bright light in the sky on March 6, 1958 at around 8:05 PM.
interesting points: The object first appeared as a white flash of light or explosion that lasted several seconds, then decreased in size and changed color to red and blue-black.
The object remained in full view for about 10 minutes before fading out.
The object did not resemble any known aircraft or missile and there were no thunderstorms or other atmospheric phenomena in the area at the time.
The object was observed to have intelligent and controlled zigzag maneuvering, with an altitude between 500 and 1,000 feet, and a duration of approximately 30 minutes.
The object was described as glowing greenish-white, very bright, and about the size of a C-47 aircraft at the same altitude, but made no audible sound.
sighted object: a bright light in the sky that changed color and size
